Package robot_2_0

Class RightHandRuleRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot_2_0.RightHandRuleRobot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Robot
    public class RightHandRuleRobot
extends java.lang.Object
implements Robot
    A class representing a robot moving through Positions in a Maze, the robot will always keep a "wall" to the right hand relative to current orientation. If the robot does not find a "wall" adjacent to the starting Position it will fail and throw an exception.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RightHandRuleRobot​(Maze m)
      Construct a RightHandRuleRobot and store functions to move different directions in arrays.

      • RightHandRuleRobot

        public RightHandRuleRobot​(Maze m)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Construct a RightHandRuleRobot and store functions to move different directions in arrays. Try to orient the robot.
        Parameters:
        m - a maze
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the robot is stuck in the starting position

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        The robot will move one step in such a way that it will always keep a "wall" on the right hand side relative to its orientation. The adjacent Positions are compared to the following cases in order: Case 1: If the Position in front of the robot is movable, and a non-movable Position is to the right of the robot, the Position of the robot is changed to the Position in "front" of the robot. The robot will then turn to the right if the adjacent Position to the right is movable. Case 2: If the Position in front of the robot is movable, the Position to the right is movable, and the Position to the right of the Position in front is movable, the robot must have just moved forward and turned right. The robot will then move forward. Case 3: Position in front of the robot is not movable, the robot will turn left and the adjacent Positions are compared again to the cases in order until the robot moves.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Robot

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Get the current Position of the robot
        Specified by:
        getPosition in interface Robot

      • hasReachedGoal

        public boolean hasReachedGoal()

        Specified by:
        hasReachedGoal in interface Robot
        Returns:
        true if the current Position is a goal
